May 27, 2025 at 9:22 PM EDT

Market Sentiment
▼
Bearish. The market sentiment is bearish with analysts expressing caution due to inflation concerns and economic slowdowns.

Dan Niles
Expressed a cautious outlook for 2025, citing inflation worries and potential AI digestion phases
Mentioned: MSFT META AAPL AMZN NVDA
Source: RiskReversal Media YouTube
Dan Benton
Shared his '20 investing rules' for technology, emphasizing the importance of innovation, management quality, and strategic foresight in tech investing
Mentioned: AAPL MSFT GOOGL NVDA TSLA
Source: RiskReversal Podcast
Guy Adami
Highlighted that banks are not immune to economic slowdowns and are among the most cyclical industries
Source: RiskReversal Media YouTube
Dan Nathan
Discussed market mayhem and noted that some Trump trades are not performing well, with Tesla trading lower than on Election Day
Mentioned: TSLA
Source: RiskReversal Media YouTube

S&P 500 Relative Strength Index (RSI)

14-day Relative Strength Index (RSI): 87.2 (Uptrend)
Oversold
Neutral
Overbought
Developed by J. Welles Wilder Jr. in 1978, the Relative Strength Index (RSI) is a 0-100 momentum oscillator: readings > 70 signal overbought, < 30 oversold, and 30-70 neutral (with 50 marking "no trend"). Values above 50 imply bullish momentum; below 50, bearish momentum.
Source: Tradier (RSI) as of May 11, 2025 at 6:03 PM EDT

Federal Reserve Policy
Market Consensus
Although swings in net exports have affected the data, recent indicators suggest that economic activity has continued to expand at a solid pace. The unemployment rate has stabilized at a low level in recent months, and labor market conditions remain solid. Inflation remains somewhat elevated.
